text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
hello my name is virant a senior
security consultant with AWS
Professional Services in Florida
today I'm going to show you how you can
turn on AWS web logging and send those
logs to Amazon cloudwatch Amazon simple
storage service or Amazon Kinesis data
fire hose let's get started first let's
choose a supported destination for your
AWS web ACL
AWS web supports the following log
destinations
a log group from Amazon cloudwatch logs
ns3 Bucket from Amazon simple storage
service a stream from Amazon Kinesis
data fire hose be sure you have the
necessary resource permissions to turn
on AWS web logs then turn on AWS web
logs using your chosen destination
to send logs to a cloudwatch logs log
group after logging into the AWS
Management console navigate to the AWS
web and AWS Shield console
on the left pane select web ACLs
to turn on logging for an existing web
ACL choose the name of the web ACL
and then choose the logging and metrics
tab
under the logging section choose the
enable icon on the top right to use
Amazon cloudwatch logs as your
destination choose the cloudwatch logs
log group option
and then select a log group
if you don't have an existing log group
that you want to redirect your logs to
choose create new
the create Law Group page appears select
a log group name with the prefix
aws-waf Dash logs Dash
select a retention setting for your log
group from the drop down list
add an AWS Key Management Service key
Arn if you want to encrypt the logs with
the preferred AWS KMS key add a tag if
you want to associate this low group
with a tag by choosing add new tag
choose create to create your new log
group
the account that turns on the AWS web
logs using a cloud watch logs log group
must have the following permissions
with we too put login configuration we
have V2 delete login configuration logs
create log delivery logs delete log
delivery logs put resource policy logs
describe resource policies logs describe
log groups
these permissions are necessary to
change the web ACL login configuration
configure log delivery and then retrieve
and edit the permissions for a log group
these permissions must be attached to
the user who is managing AWS web
to send logs to an Amazon S3 bucket
navigate to the AWS web and AWS Shield
console
on the left pane select web ACLS to turn
on logging for an existing web ACL
choose the name of the web ACL and then
choose the login and metrics tab
under the logging section choose the
enable icon on the top right
to use Amazon S3 bucket as your
destination choose the S3 bucket option
and then select an S3 bucket
if you don't have an existing S3 bucket
that you want to redirect your logs to
choose create new
the create bucket page appears select a
unique bucket name with the prefix
aws-wav Dash logs Dash
select the region for your S3 Bucket
from the drop down list
keep the default settings unless you
want to modify your S3 buckets
parameters
choose create bucket to create your new
S3 buckets
after log group is created choose save
to turn on logging
the account that turns on the AWS wav
logs using an S3 bucket must have the
following permissions
we have V2 put login configuration we
have V2 delete login configuration
logs create log delivery logs delete log
delivery
S3 put bucket policy S3 get bucket
policy these permissions are necessary
to turn on AWS web logging and to
configure log delivery for an S3 bucket
they are also needed to retrieve and
edit the bucket policy to allow AWS web
log delivery to an S3 bucket
to send logs to an Amazon Kinesis data
fire hose
after logging into the AWS Management
console navigate to the AWS web and AWS
Shield console
on the left pane select web ACLS to turn
on logging for an existing web ACL
choose the name of the web ACL
and then choose the logging and metrics
tab
under the logging section choose the
enable icon on the top right
to use Amazon Kinesis data fire hose as
your destination choose the Kinesis data
fire host stream option and select the
delivery stream
if you don't have an existing delivery
stream that you want to redirect your
logs to choose create new
the create delivery stream page appears
for Source choose the direct put option
from the drop down list for Destination
choose from the available destinations
for Kinesis data fire hose
select a unique delivery stream name
with the prefix
aws-waf Dash logs Dash
make sure that you are in the same
region where you created your web ACL by
checking your region from top right of
the console
make sure the transform Source records
with AWS Lambda and the convert record
format options are not active
enter the destination settings according
to the destination that you selected
keep the default advanced settings
unless you must modify them
choose create delivery stream
after the delivery stream is created
choose save to turn on logging
the account that turns on the AWS wath
logs using an S3 bucket must have the
following permissions with V2 put login
configuration with V2 delete login
configuration I am create service linked
role fire hose list delivery streams
these permissions are necessary to turn
on AWS web logging and to configure log
delivery for a Kinesis data fire host
delivery stream so now you know how to
turn on AWS web logging and send logs to
cloudwatch Amazon S3 or Kinesis data
fire hose thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
foreign
[Music]
[Music]
